result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ameer A Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Ameer A
defendant.address: 631 S Green Bay Rd #7, Mount Pleasant, WI 53406

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

8:46 AM Defendant Ameer A Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexia S Gianitsos in court for Ameer A Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matter is scheduled on Defense's Motion to modify bond.
Defense is requesting that bond be amended to a $200 signature bond.
Deft is being supervised by probation.
Deft is going to be getting treatment in a in patient treatment facility.
State has some concerns and objects to a bond modification.
BTC: Modify bond to a $750 signature bond, all conditions remain.
State has filed an amended complaint adding count 3.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
